title: New Chinese Space Station Crew Arrives at Tiangong-3 Space Station
summary: China continued its new pattern of space station crew exchanges today with the launch of the three-man Shenzhou-18 crew. They docked with the Tiangong-3 space station 6.5 hours after launch […]

title: Space startup True Anomaly cuts workforce
summary: The layoffs come just weeks after an unsuccessful debut mission for True Anomaly’s Jackal spacecraft launched to low Earth orbit

title: China’s Shenzhou-18 crew arrive at Tiangong space station
summary: China’s three Shenzhou-18 mission  astronauts arrived at the Tiangong space station Thursday following launch from Jiuquan spaceport.

title: NASA shares updated render of the Cargo Starship variant
summary: NASA shared updated renders of the SpaceX and Blue Origin cargo landers that will bring rovers and other equipment to the Moon....

title: If Starship is real, we’re going to need big cargo movers on the Moon and Mars
summary: "I left SpaceX knowing the width of the Starship door."

title: Nicaragua signs up to China’s ILRS moon program
summary: Nicaragua has joined the ILRS moon base program as China continues its push to attract partners for the project.

title: NASA planning September launch of Mars smallsat mission on first New Glenn
summary: A NASA Mars smallsat mission is slated to launch in late September on the first flight of Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket, assuming the vehicle is ready in time.

title: Russia vetoes U.N. resolution on nuclear weapons in space
summary: Russia, as expected, vetoed April 24 a United Nations Security Council resolution crafted in response to reports that the country was developing a nuclear anti-satellite weapon.

title: SLIM Does It Again — Survives Another Lunar Night
summary: Japan’s lunar lander is defying all the odds, surviving yet another bitter cold lunar night. The Smart Lander for Investigating Moon, or SLIM, landed in January and was expected to […]

title: Russia Vetoes U.N. Security Council Resolution on Nuclear Weapons in Space
summary: Russia vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution today that would have reaffirmed the provision in the 1967 Outer Space Treaty prohibiting nations from placing nuclear weapons in Earth orbit. […]
